text: why are these elephants running
are they happy are they frolicking or
are they running away in fear from
another elephant that's bitten one of
them if you were an elephant you'd know
that they are very distressed and
researchers say you'd probably rush over
to console them until now only a few
kinds of non-human animals have been
known to console each other when a
fellow has been attacked Apes wolves and
some kinds of birds although there are
lots of anecdotes about dolphins and
other cetaceans the researchers figured
that elephants who are highly
intelligent and social would also try to
cheer each other up so they studied 26
elephants and six groups and a park and
Thailand the scientific definition of
consolation requires that it come after
an attack and the researchers didn't
always know what disturb the elephants
sometimes it might have been people or
dogs or a noise but otherwise the
elephant behavior fit the bill
elephant bystanders gathered round the
distressed animal they made chirping
sounds and they touched each other in
ways that the researchers say are
reassuring to elephants evidence of
empathy and yet one more animal
